text: [Music]
[Applause]
[Music]
hello I'm Manish a cloud engineer here
at the AWS office in Melbourne today I'm
going to show you how to create another
administrator account or how to
duplicate administrator user privilege
for Amazon relational database service
database instance that's running my SQL
let's get
started it's a best practice to not use
admin administrator or primary user in
applications this mean to create an
application user with fewer privileges
so you can separate administrator or
primary user duties and the application
user duties to do so let's connect to
mySQL database instance and run the show
grants command in MySQL client to
capture the permission associated with
the primary
user after logging to the MySQL
Management console navigate to the
Amazon RDS
console navigate to database section
from left panel and select my RS from my
SQ database under the connectivity and
security tab I'll use the MySQL endpoint
to connect to the database under the
configuration tab note the primary or
Master username of the
instance using this information I can
connect to any MySQL client to connect
to my Amazon RDS for myql database we
are connected to mySQL version 8 and
connected to mySQL database now I can
run a command to show grants of the
primary user admin in this test the
primary user name is called admin you
might have a different name in your
instance these are the Privileges
granted to primary or user admin let's
copy this permission to text file and
then we'll create a new primary user run
the Grant command to Grant the list of
permission that saw in the previous step
to the new user the new user has now the
same permission as the admin or primary
account so now you know how to create
another administrator or how to
duplicate administrator or primary user
privilege for my RDS database instance
that's running my
SQL thanks for watching and a Happy
Cloud Computing from all of us here at
AWS
[Applause]
[Music]
[Music]
